shapes3d
Class Shape3D

java.lang.Object
  shapes3d.Shape3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
processing.core.PConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
Anchor, Box, Cone, Mesh2DCore, Terrain, Xshape
public abstract class Shape3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements processing.core.PConstants

Abstract class - the base for all 3D shape classes.
Provides functionality to control position, rotation, color and draw mode of the various shapes available in this library.
See drawMode(int mode) for details on the draw modes available.
This class supports the selection of a 3D shape at a given x/y screen position. It uses a colour picking algorithm where each object is drawn with a unique colour ignoring lighting and surface normals. The colour at the x/y screen position can then be used to identify the shape.
This would normally be done using an off-screen buffer in P3D mode. Unfortunately a bug in Processing (see bug report 1393) means that clipping is not working correctly in P3D mode so this class provides two methods and the user can select whichever performs best in their application. The methods are 

pickShapeB(PApplet papplet, int x, int y)

This uses an off-screen P3D buffer and works with Processing V1.0.5; in V1.0.9 the clipping bug means that objects behind the view point are drawn to the buffer giving a distorted image. This is particularly noticeable when using the Terrain class in this library. If all the objects are 'in front' the camera view then this method works fine. 
pickShape(PApplet papplet, int x, int y)

This uses the actual applet screen as the buffer thus resulting in a flicker to black when this method is called. It is only worth using this method if the main applet screen is using OPENGL (using P3D mode means you have the flicker and all the problems mentioned earlier). Since it uses OpenGL to perform the clipping it means it bypasses the bug in P3D.

Author:
Peter Lager

tag

public java.lang.String tag
User defined tag for this shape.
This can be any text the user likes or finds useful. When a shape is created this is initialised to the name of the class e.g. Toroid, Cone etc.

tagNo

public int tagNo
User defined tag number.
This can be any number the user likes or finds useful.

pickShape

public static Shape3D pickShape(processing.core.PApplet papplet,
                                int x,
                                int y)
Identify the 3D shape which is under the 2D screen pixel position given by [x,y]
Uses the main applet screen for the buffer so results in quick flicker to black when called. Only really useful if using OPENGL for you main display.

Parameters:
papplet - the main class that extends PApplet
x -
y -
Returns:
reference to the selected shape or null if not over a shape

Uses an off-screen P3D buffer so will experience problems associated with bug in P3D clipping found in V1.0.9 of Processing
Sets the camera and projection matrices to match that of the PApplet

drawMode

public void drawMode(int mode)
Sets the draw mode for the shape.
The three constants Shape3D.SOILD, Shape3D.WIRE and Shape3D.TEXTURE are used to determine how the shape is drawn. These can be or-ed together to get different drawing combinations e.g. Shape3D.SOLID | Shape3D.WIRE would be a coloured shape with edges. If the parameter is Shape3D.TEXTURE then and a texture has not been set then it will use SOLID.

Parameters:
mode -

drawMode

public void drawMode(int mode,
                     int parts)
This method is overridden in the classes that have multiple parts e.g. Cone, Tube and Helix

Parameters:
mode -
parts -

drawMode

public int drawMode()
Get the draw mode

Returns:
Shape3D.SOILD, Shape3D.WIRE or Shape3D.TEXTURE

adjustToTerrain

public void adjustToTerrain(Terrain t,
                            int tMode,
                            float heightAbove)
Will adjust the shape's position to ensure that it is over the terrain at a given height above it.

Parameters:
t - the terrain we want to use
tMode - Terrain.CLAMP or Terrain.WRAP
heightAbove - the height of the eye above the terrain

pickColor

public boolean pickColor(int pcol)
Set the pick colour for this shape.
Included for those rare occasions when you might want to set your own pick colour. It enforces the rule that the pick colour is unique for each shape, so if you specify an existing colour no changes are made and the method returns false. It returns true if the pick colour was changed successfully.

Parameters:
pcol - the new pick color

pickColor

public int pickColor()
Get the pick colour for this shape

Returns:
the pick color value

finishedWith

public void finishedWith()
If you have finished with a shape call this method to remove it from the list of shapes to draw / pick.
This enables garbage collection to release memory allocated to this shape.
